It's a simple and moderately user friendly layout with a super concept behind it but the app only works on your home screen which even then, your 'now' modified icon bar will only reappear when you open an app, otherwise it's the factory installed default until Status kicks back in.  There's quite a bit of finessing and bugs that need squashing this requires still and when I say quite a bit, I mean a lot. So much so that this isn't even worth the download. Doesn't work when your web browser is open or on your lock screen and the headphone icon is missing in action when you plug your headphones in. Strangely, this app takes up very little space on your home screen but uses a ton of ram and battery power to operate because the application has to continually be running in the background for it to work so it makes your phone run slow when you're browsing or pretty much doing anything and I've got a nice phone, also requires a ridiculous amount of permissions to function to the point of myself feeling sketchy about even having something like this 'in' my phone.   When you swipe down on your home screen to see what's going on, the app is always running and cannot be removed or swiped away. I have a weather app called Wunderground installed. Status completely took priority over that one and totally shut it out so that it wasn't even visible when I swiped down.  I'm sorry to bash this app but it's far from being complete, still needs a ton of work to operate properly and behaves strangely because it has been granted far too much power over your phone's permissions and that in itself is a huge red flag. It's about 50% there in completion. It was fun for an hour until I saw first hand how it really operates and had to uninstall...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Very late response (sorry), but damn this is a good review. Unfortunately I cannot 'fix' any of your comments just because this is the only possible way for Status to operate without requiring root access, but god I wish all users wrote reviews as detailed as this one. All of your criticisms are completely valid.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is one of the most helpful apps on Google play when it comes to customization

Hello! I left a negative review here a few months ago, but I have no idea what I was thinking. This is a fantastic app, one of the best for customization, and I like it a lot. I would highly recommend it to anyone that wants something unique at the top of their screen. My only complaint is the lack of options for individual icons, like limiting notifications. For example, in my configuration, having more than four notifications pushes the battery icon off the screen. If this was added, this would totally be a five star review.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi! The next update will be released by the end of the month, and will contain an option to automatically hide icons that are cut off by other parts of the status bar (or the edge of the screen). It has a bit of an impact on battery life, so it won't be enabled by default, but that will improve in future updates.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: The time is obtained from the system - it gets the time once when it's first enabled, then it refreshes once per minute (also handled by the android system). Updates could've been delayed from memory issues (I doubt the animations were helping), or the clock could have been set to the wrong time zone for a minute until it got the first update.
